Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
game.actors.nonplayercharacters.traders.enemies.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Capable, Printable, RunesRewarder
Direct Known Subclasses:
CanisLupus, Crustacean, Skeleton
public abstract class Enemy extends Actor implements RunesRewarder

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(String name, char displayChar, int hitPoints, int spawnChance, int despawnChance, int minRunes, int maxRunes)
      Constructor for Enemy.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Enemy.
      displayChar - the character that will represent the Enemy in the display
      hitPoints - the Enemy's starting hit points.
      spawnChance - the Enemy's spawning chance from its specific ground.
      despawnChance - the Enemy's despawning chance from the game map.
      minRunes - the minimum runes dropped by Enemy if defeated by player.
      maxRunes - the maximum runes dropped by Enemy if defeated by player.
      See Also:
      • WanderBehaviour
      • RunesManager.getInstance()
      • RunesManager.registerRunesRewarder(RunesRewarder)

  • Method Details

    • playTurn

      public Action playTurn(ActionList actions, Action lastAction, GameMap map, Display display)
      If the game is being reset during this round, return DoNothingAction for every Enemy; else Select and return an action to perform for the Enemy on the current turn. If Enemy meets their specific despawn chance in any round of the game, Despawn Action will be returned.
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Enemy
      lastAction - The Action this Enemy took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Enemy
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      the Action to be performed
      See Also:
      • RandomNumberGenerator.getRandomInt(int)
      • DespawnAction
      • DoNothingAction
      • Status.FOLLOWING

    • allowableActions

      public ActionList allowableActions(Actor otherActor, String direction, GameMap map)
      Returns a new collection of the Actions that the otherActor can do to the current Enemy. Also, Attack Behaviour will be put into the behaviours HashMap of this enemy, if it can attack the otherActor, e.g. the otherActor is not of the same type of this enemy and otherActor is not having capability of PROTECTED.
      Overrides:
      allowableActions in class Actor
      Parameters:
      otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack on this Enemy.
      direction - String representing the direction of the other Actor.
      map - current GameMap
      Returns:
      A collection of Actions.
      See Also:
      • ActionList
      • FollowBehaviour
      • AttackAction
      • Status.HOSTILE_TO_ENEMY
      • Status.FOLLOWING
      • Status.SPECIAL_SKILL

    • increaseMaxHp

      public void increaseMaxHp(int points)
      Increases maximum hit points and set current hit points to that new maximum hit points. Remove the Follow Behaviour from the Enemy before increasing its health.
      Overrides:
      increaseMaxHp in class Actor
      Parameters:
      points - number of points that is added to maximum health

    • getBehaviours

      Returns:
